Full Job Description
Job Description:
Company Overview

Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner, Stone Brewing has come a long way since opening in San Diego County in 1996. Now the ninth-largest craft brewer in the U.S., we operate brewing facilities on both coasts - Escondido, California and Richmond, Virginia. On top of making badass beers for over two decades, we operate a number of restaurants and tap rooms as well as the largest craft-centric beer distribution business in the U.S.

We are the global standard bearer for independent craft beer. We put Team Stone first in order to create badass beer and amazing experiences. We're quality nuts and freshness fanatics, and we're head over heels for hops. We’re proud to be the largest employer in craft beer with a dynamic team. We have always been independent, and we will always be independent. We’re on the lookout for like-minded misfits who embody the things that have always made Stone special.

Role Summary

The I.T. intern will work on our large projects focused on helping us implement some of Azure application provisioning (i.e. individuals in role / department x get concur and help set up automatically. This intern will work with us, as well as our Microsoft partner, FMT. They will get introductory experience and training in Cloud, Azure and Business Analysis. This individual will have the opportunity to grow his/her skills and knowledge in the I.T. field while working in a fast-paced, exciting industry.

Responsibilities include:
10 - 12 week that is flexible (A combo of full time or part time, in person or remote)

Assisting the I.T. team with deliverables with the ongoing Azure provisioning

Required Experience:
Qualifications

Junior or Senior (preferred) pursuing a bachelor’s degree in I.T., Computer Science, or related field

Must be a motivated individual passionate about pursuing a career in I.T. and learning on the job experience

Ability to still have fun and be positive in high intensity situations

Demonstrates effective teamwork and collaboration skills

Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

Must be comfortable with being uncomfortable and doing things differently

Adaptable to a changing, fast-paced environment

Maintains high degree of integrity and confidentiality, always doing the right thing

From: Stone Brewing Co.

Full Job Description

Full Job Description

Fortunesoft IT Innovations, Inc is a high end software product engineering & services company based out of Nashville, Tennessee. We are specialised in offering end to end technology solution to Fin-tech, eCommerce, Healthcare and Faith-tech companies. In addition to US, Fortunesoft has offices in Bangalore, India and Singapore.

Fortunesoft IT Innovations, Inc. is looking for Interns to work with their Sales & Marketing office at Nashville, Tennessee. Job description includes contacting prospective clients, requirement gathering, organising meeting with in-house technology team and providing technology solutions to the customers.

Opportunity

The Interns will get an immersive experience in Business development, Account management and Sales experience for high end software product engineering services.

Part Time or Full Time: Part Time during school year and additional hours possible in summer

A Day In The Life
Business development, contacting prospective clients, requirement gathering, organising meeting with in-house technology team, providing technology solutions and updating accurate contact information of customers in CRM.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Self-starter with a commitment to professional development
  • Passion for learning and business requirement gathering
  • Experience with lead generation and developing new prospects through outreach a plus
  • Event support experience a plus
  • SalesForce or similar CRM exposure a plus
  • Preferred majors: sales, business, communication, entrepreneurial studies, marketing or an information technology/computer science field

Compensation: In addition to the hourly rates you will receive a commission on sales generated by your lead generation. You will also have an opportunity to become a team member upon successful completion of the internship and performance.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Commission pay

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

Full Job Description

The Freedonia Group, a division of MarketResearch.com, is one of the leading global suppliers of off-the-shelf industrial research studies, specializing in plastics, chemicals, construction, industrial components, packaging and other topics. Located in Cleveland, Ohio, the company has been in business for over twenty-five years. In addition, The Freedonia Group’s industry market research is considered an authoritative source by the world’s leading publications and has been featured in nearly every relevant trade publication.

We are currently looking to hire a tech-related intern, to help provide remote and on-site support for our employees. The successful candidate will also gain a wide variety of hands-on experience in a multitude of areas.

Responsibilities:

· Remote and on-site support of end users in all company and remote locations.

· Support the Tech Team in maintaining hardware, software and other systems

· Organize and maintain IT Resources.

· Assist in maintenance of IT inventory and accessories

· Lend IT support in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics, and data management

Requirements:

· Working towards or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems (Or related)

· Minimum 3.0 GPA

· Familiar with Windows 10, Windows Server 2008 and newer, Desktop and Laptop hardware, and basics of wired and wireless networking

· Comport oneself in a professional manner at all times

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Strong problems-solving skills

· Ability to work in an isolated environment and in teams

· Strong worth ethic, discipline and attention to detail

Benefits

· Gain hands-on experience in an IT position that is both on-site AND remote.

· Opportunity to attend events and meetings with company management and executives

· Flexible schedule for students

· A chance to move the technology of a company from one site to another

· Compensation available

Besides the excellent learning opportunity, interns are welcome to participate in the day-to-day activities of Freedonia - including attending holiday parties, board-game nights, organized hikes, annual cooking competitions, etc.

Interns with The Freedonia Group will maintain a work schedule as determined by Freedonia and the intern. We are willing to work around school and activities schedules.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $1.00 - $2.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Job Summary: Provides technical support to Terrybear’s internal team including systems admin. This position will be responsible for taking on day to day tasks such as users’ computer related issues, both hardware and software, along with providing admin support as needed. This individual will be the person who evaluates IT tickets and recommends solution or escalates it to senior team members.

Key
Accountabilities
Key Activities
IT Ticket Management

· Monitors day to day IT tickets

· Reviews, resolves and logs tickets or escalates if needed

· Maintains SLA standards in completion of tickets

· Contributes to IT knowledge base for future references

· Using diagnostic techniques and problem-solving methods to troubleshoot issues remotely and/or on-site visit as necessary

Project Support

· Supports/participates in integration/applications/systems of IT projects

Website Support

· Supports IT team on website related tasks

· Documents website sync issues and escalates as needed

Education and Experience

· Pursuit of a degree in Computer Science/IT related field, or 1-2 years equivalent work experience

· Experience with Windows 10 Pro Operating Systems

· Experience with Microsoft Office 365 products

· Understanding of Network Switches and Firewall

· Knowledge in Microsoft Dynamics NAV 2018 ERP system is preferred

· Experience in SQL database is preferred

· Understanding of API connections is a plus

· VMware Servers experience is a plus

Competencies (Behaviors and Technical Skills)

· Must be self-motivated and have the ability to multitask

· Detail oriented, organized and competence in prioritizing tasks

· Excellent problem-solving skills – identifying complex problems, reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

· Must have great communication skills, both written and verbal

· Ability to troubleshoot issues by demonstrating root-cause approach

· Quick learner in understanding business concepts and inter-departmental processes

· Must have a sense of urgency (when applicable) and capability to meet deadlines

· Critical thinker – using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of different solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

Description:
About Us

Sarma offers multiple service offerings to help consumers and businesses make key decisions. These decisions range from employment, financial decisions, collections activity, profitability growth, purchases, and more. These services include but are not limited to

  • Mortgage Credit Services
  • Recovery Management Services
  • Employment Screening
  • Tenant Screening
We are looking for part-time paid interns who are eager to learn and motivated to contribute to Sarma’s success.

Sarma’s internships are designed to offer hands-on experience in a professional business environment. Interns will be supporting the operations, production, and support departments of the Organization. They will be responsible for supporting the office with challenging projects and assignments.

. Requirements:

  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills

Full Job Description

This job is a 100% remote, unpaid internship (with the option of college credit) giving industry experience to designers looking to advance their career by building high-quality software products with a team in an Agile manner.

Minority Programmers Association is an international network of programmers and activists empowering underrepresented communities through STEM education, mentorship, job placement, and the development of socially impactful software solutions.

https://minorityprogrammers.com/

A key to developing impactful software solutions is designing responsive and beautiful web applications. As a result, Minority Programmers Association is proud to announce the creation of an Product Design Intern (Unpaid) position.

We are seeking a determined and creative designer who is passionate about changing the world through technology!

This role will report to a Senior Software Engineer at the Minority Programmers Association.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the brand.
  • Guiding software product through various stages in the lifecycle
  • Work with designers and engineers to brainstorm application ideas.
  • Collaborating with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user
  • Accurately translate user and business requirements into digital prototypes
  • Adhering to style and brand standards on typography and graphic design
  • Ensuring user experience determines design choices
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
  • Develop wireframes and prototypes on applications such as Figma
  • Testing UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages
  • Ensure that web applications are optimized for various devices.
  • Reflect on data to analyze trends
  • Create test models to gauge user enjoyment and engagement.
  • Execute layout adjustments based on user feedback
  • Generate reports on project statuses and thoroughly track on ClickUp (project management tool)
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements and analyze product designs
  • 15-20 weekly hours (with the ability to make synchronous meetings) for at least a 3 month commitment

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

  • Must be 18 years or older
  • Currently enrolled or completed Bachelor’s degree in UI/UX Design, Graphic Design, Industrial Design, Software Engineering, Data, Computer Science, or related field(s) with a Cumulative GPA of 2.7 or above OR completion of full stack coding bootcamp
  • A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms
  • Available to work before or on August 1st, 2021
  • Understanding of key design principles; drawing and sketching, color theory, use of texture, typography, as well as visual presentation development and layout.
  • Understanding of SEO principles
  • 1+ year experience in UI/UX and graphic design
  • Passion for technology and community
  • Strong attention to details + deadlines.
  • Passion to learn and advance career
  • Must have own laptop and phone
  • Not afraid to ask questions!

Pay: Up to $12.00 per hour

  • Monday to Friday

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • Figma: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Adobe Illustrator: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Wireframing: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Prototyping: 1 year (Preferred)
  • User research: 1 year (Preferred)

Full Job Description

Seeking software engineering interns for 12 week internship starting August 2021.

Minutes4Moms has been been serving customers with on-demand child care in Maryland for the past 5 years. We are a small but quickly growing company currently in the process of expanding to several new areas. At Minutes4Moms you will be working in a dynamic environment, solving complex problems with a real world impact.

We are currently seeking software engineering interns to assist in automating many aspects of our business. In this role you would be working closely with a team of developers to build web applications that improve the efficiency of business operations. Possible additional projects include developing customer facing mobile applications. Products of your work on will quickly be launched into production and have a real and immediate impact on our employees and customers.

Some requirements of the role are:

  • Strong understanding of object oriented design principles and data structures
  • Experience in application development, especially the AGILE development process
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
  • Ability to collaborate well with other team members
  • Strong problem solving abilities
  • Flexibility and adaptability

Other preferred requirements:

  • Experience using React.js, Firebase, Node.js
  • Experience in mobile app development, especially using flutter
  • Currently working toward a 4 year degree in Computer Science or a related field

Both full-time and part-time opportunities are available for this fall.

Our Los Angeles office is seeking interns who are currently pursuing a bachelor of arts or masters in marketing, computer science, photography, design or other related fields to assist our marketing team. RESPONSIBILITIES

Full Job Description
This is a full- or part-time internship for college students and can include a Capstone project in a Healthcare IT topic to be agreed upon.

Student will work with a JPSYS employee on a Healthcare IT project and/or day-to-day activities and learn about how we make clinical data Interoperability work for our clients.

Position Mission and Overview:
Mission: J P Systems provides professional services for international Healthcare IT projects. Make a difference by helping us to architect the global sharing of medical data between healthcare providers, patients, agencies and countries around the world.

Overview: We are seeking Healthcare IT or Information Systems majors. Must have ability to follow instructions precisely. Excellent writing and web research skills OR technical analysis skills, and a positive attitude are highly desired. An interest in Healthcare IT systems desired. Familiarity with MS Office Suite (Word, Outlook and Power Point) a must. Microsoft Teams experience preferred.

Intern will perform the following functions while working in System Performance:

Analyze Data
Develop presentations with graphs, observations, etc.
Hone your presentation skills

Desire to learn new skills, eager to watch email carefully each day for assignments, ability to follow orders and work well with others. Individual must be honest, loyal, hard-working and highly motivated to work unsupervised. Must meet deadlines and come in under time budget set by supervisor. Ability to discuss technical solutions and propose the best fit. Ability to communicate well with people is a must, as are writing and grammar skills. Proficiency in MS Office suite including Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word required. Graphics experience is a plus.

Prerequisites Desired: Information Systems, Computer Science, Healthcare IT or similar course work; working on BA in Healthcare IT, Computer Science, Nursing Informatics or related field.

Qualifications: Applicants must possess strong desire to learn and ability to work well with others. Individual must be highly motivated to work unsupervised, honest, loyal, and hard working. Must meet deadlines and come in under budget for hours set by supervisor. Ability to interface with clients, both internal and external, listen well, propose and discuss technical solutions is very important.

All applicants may be subject to drug testing and background checks per our employment policies and Federal contracting requirements. You must be over 16 years of age and have completed two years of college to be eligible for these internships.

J P Systems does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

No phone calls, please.

Please note that this position is 100% virtual. J P Systems is headquartered in Northern Virginia.

In order to ensure you receive emails from J P Systems, please add notifications@app.bamboohr.com to your address book.

position: Exciting Business Marketing Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 agenda, including:

  • Sparrow's app store launch
  • Email marketing campaigns
  • User feedback communication
  • Data analytics system
  • Social media presence (including content creation)
  • Public relations
  • Influencer outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $50.00 per week

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We are working entirely remotely to ensure the safety of all employees while also staying on track with the goals of the company.

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

  • Digital Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Business: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Full Job Description

Responsibilities

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Use Tableau to build and publish customized interactive reports, data visualizations, and executive level dashboards that are in support our development team operations
  • Take ownership and enhance existing tableau visualizations that our business is dependent on, such as road mapping and agile metrics dashboards.
  • Analyze and integrate complex data coming in from multiple disparate sources; Use SQL to create published data sources that enable you, your stakeholders, and internal customers to retrieve key data/metrics/reports.
  • Work closely and build relationships with data engineers in other teams in Tableau to communicate requirements and drive dependency completion.
  • Validate telemetry analysis with internal customers and power users
  • Draw insight from data and have the ability to visually present and communicate data, analyses, and findings orally and in writing.
  • Troubleshoot data issues with Tableau reports and dashboards.
  • Contribute to expanding the Tableau data science

Requirements

  • Understanding of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel or Python)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Background in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: From $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

position: Exciting Graphic Design Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Fall 2021

Full Job Description
NVIDIA is using the power of GPU computing and AI to revolutionize healthcare by transforming data analysis in domains such as DNA sequencing. We are seeking passionate and hardworking individuals to help us realize our mission of bringing personalized medicine to mainstream healthcare.

As an HPC Engineer Intern, you will join a fast-paced development team focused on bioinformatics algorithm development and collaborations with industry and academic partners. This position provides the opportunity to define, implement, productize, and deliver high-performance computing software for a wide range of bioinformatics applications used worldwide. If you are interested in taking on the greatest healthcare computational challenges for your internship, this would be a perfect opportunity!

What you will be doing:
Study and develop cutting-edge techniques in bioinformatics, graph algorithms, machine learning, and perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current- and next-generation GPU architectures.

Work directly with key customers to understand the current and future problems they are solving and provide the best HPC solutions.

Collaborate closely with hardware engineering, CUDA engineering, and AI research groups to apply the latest technology to enable novel genomic analysis at scale.

What we need to see:
You are pursuing your MS degree or PhD in Computer Science, or a similar technical field of study

Strong knowledge of C/C++, software design, and programming techniques.

Experience with the design and implementation of complex algorithms and data structures.

Parallel programming experience using multi-threading or MPI.

Understanding of computer system architecture and operating systems.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Knowledge and understanding of parallel programming, thread programming, concurrency control, and scalability.

Experience with CUDA programming and NVIDIA GPUs

Background with DL and Machine Learning algorithms

Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills to effectively guide and influence within a dynamic, technical environment

NVIDIA offers highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us to provide capabilities to the life sciences industry which could not be imagined even a few years ago. If you're creative and love building the next generation of technologies that will be used throughout the world and have a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.

The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in Colorado. The base hourly range for this position in Colorado is $31.80 - 43.73 USD.

NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave, professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.

Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
Our formula for success is to hire exceptional people, encourage their ideas and reward their results.

As a Quantitative Trading Analyst Intern, you will gain exposure to the dynamic worlds of trading and technology in order to learn what it takes to become a successful and sustainable trader. You will work on a small team to combine the disciplines of technology, research and risk management to identify optimal trading and investment strategies within the regulatory framework through a series of project based assignments. At the conclusion of 10 weeks, you will have the opportunity to present your results to senior leadership at DRW. While your days will have you engrossed with complex quantitative trading projects, your evenings will be spent exploring the city with organized social events to truly discover what it’s like to live and work in Chicago, Greenwich, Houston & New York.

How you will make an impact…

Collaborate with senior traders, technologists and quantitative researchers by developing and improving trading strategies by working directly on the trading desk
Identify and research in the development of cutting-edge market research projects using powerful analytic tools
Market research projects vary from macroeconomic data curation and analysis to application of machine learning techniques to market tick data for automated trading
Be given immediate responsibility through assignments like position tracking, calculating risk, and analyzing vital theoretical values

What you bring to the team…

Are pursuing a bachelor’s, master’s or PhD in mathematics, economics, physics, statistics, computer science or any engineering related field and have an expected graduation date between December 2022 and June 2023
Advanced quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to deploy those skills under time-sensitive situations
Proficient programming in Python
Are self-motivated, enjoy challenges and significant responsibility, and thrive in fast-paced, competitive environments
A passion for the financial markets and a deep curiosity to explore new methodologies
Strong communication skills to advocate your ideas in a clear and concise manner to the group

What to expect during the internship

Meaningful projects: Each project, advised by a trader, promotes a comprehensive learning experience and provides you with real-world work experience.
Community: Throughout the summer, we host a variety of educational, social and team-building activities to explore the city, foster friendships and camaraderie.
Housing: DRW provides fully furnished apartments located close to the office – making your morning commute as easy as possible.
Mentorship: You’ll build a professional relationship with an experienced mentor in your field. Mentors and mentees meet to discuss goals, challenges and professional development and explore the city together at our mentor outings.
Education: As the trading industry continually evolves, both in terms of new products and transaction methods, the future will present us with unique opportunities and challenges. You’ll complete an options course taught by an experienced trader and participate in a technology immersion course to better understand how technology and trading intersect.

DRW is a technology-driven, diversified principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in financial markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW – maximizing opportunities to include real estate, cryptoassets and venture capital. With over 1,000 employees at our Chicago headquarters and offices around the world, we work together to solve complex problems, challenge consensus and deliver meaningful results. It’s a place of high expectations, deep curiosity and thoughtful collaboration.

description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Public Relations & Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 Agenda and related Public Relations, including:

  • Sparrow's App Store Launch
  • Sparrow's upcoming Equity Crowdfunding Campaign
  • Email Marketing Campaigns
  • Social Media Presence
  • Public Relations
  • Influencer Outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools
  • Be someone excited to learn
  • Be able to outreach to other companies and professionals

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Gain Experience in the PR and Business Marketing Fields
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility
Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.
The technical publications internship offers the chance for students or recent graduates to get hands-on experience creating and managing content for the next generation of electric vehicles at Lucid. Lucid’s paid interns will work alongside the Technical Publications team in support of its department-specific goal: we transform complex information into content that helps end-users perform the correct action. Along the way, you’ll learn much about how an electric vehicle is transformed from an idea on a whiteboard to a vehicle in a customer’s driveway. Lucid interns will be immersed in a work environment that’s supportive of curiosity, encourages independent problem-solving, and provides many opportunities to learn new skills. Responsibilities
Review, design, write and edit technical and process documentation. (That’s kind of in the job title, isn’t it? Tech writers need to write stuff.)
Learn and compile documentation using the DITA XML specification. (The focus is on the documentation content more than the look and feel.)
Learn and apply Lucid standards for clarity, style, and terminology.
Generate and manage images using CAD modeling tools.
Meet with subject matter experts in several of Lucid’s Service and Engineering departments.
Track work with project management tools: tickets, project dashboards, Kanban boards, etc.
Understand and participate in documentation lifecycle management. Qualifications
Associate’s, Bachelor’s, or Post-Secondary Degree in Journalism, Computer Science, Creative Writing or related fields (Recent graduates are eligible up to 12 months after graduation.
Excellent writing and editing skills
Demonstrable organization and detail-oriented skill
A mindset that enjoys new challenges and solving problems
Expertise with Microsoft Office: Word, Outlook, Excel, OneNote, PowerPoint – you’ll learn other authoring tools and platforms while you’re here; it’s expected that you have MS Office knowhow on day one. Preferred Qualifications
If you’re fluent in French or Arabic, please mention it on the resume. Lucid is a global company, and documentation needs to be translated.
Experience with XML, or knowledge of the DITA XML specification
Experience with CAD tools
Previous experience relating to journalism (ie. writing for a school newspaper) is a plus
Project management or other operational experience

Please include with your application:
Résumé
Portfolio / writing samples
Relevant courses taken while in school Other
Programming Timing: September 7th – November 26th, 2021 (12 weeks); End date can be extended up to December 23rd, 2021 based on individual needs; Some flexibility with start date is available if needed
Availability: Full-time and Part-Time available
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start on site for your first day of employment
Work Environment: Office, Service Engineering team
Anticipated Hours: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week
Housing: No compensation for housing
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses currently
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors, you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers, or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department. Be part of something amazing
Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.
At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.
To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Full Job Description
Our formula for success is to hire exceptional people, encourage their ideas and reward their results.

As a Software Developer Intern, you will build advanced trading and risk applications leveraging cutting-edge technology. DRW enables our Software Developer Interns to develop computationally intensive software under the guidance of senior technologists with the goal of deployment during your ten weeks. While your days will have you immersed in complex projects directly driving DRW’s progress, your evenings will be spent exploring the city with organized social events to truly discover what it is like to live and work in Chicago.

How you will make an impact…

Design, develop test, and deploy proprietary software development solutions across the firm. Examples include creating:
Decoders to receive raw pack data from various exchanges and translate it into a more accessible form.
Normalizers which take decoded data and build a book for each instrument traded on that exchange
Applications to facilitate communication around executed trades to our compliance team
Identify innovative solutions to complex problems and advocate for their implementation to your team by communicating your ideas in a clear and concise manner
Conduct robust research using a data driven approach to employ statistical analytics on large data sets
Collaborate with other software developers, quantitative traders and researchers as well as business analysts in cross-functional team environments

What you bring to the team…

Are pursuing a bachelor’s, master’s, or PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, computer engineering, physics, mathematics or any related science discipline and have an expected graduation date between December 2022 and June 2024
Have exposure to network programming (TCP/IP), multi‐threaded applications, computational intelligence, algorithms, real‐time programming or GUI programming
Have strong understanding of object oriented design, data structures, and algorithms
Exhibit excellent software development skills in C++, Python, Java, C#, or C and a deep curiosity to learn and absorb new technologies quickly

What to expect during the internship…

Meaningful projects: You’ll receive a challenging project to complete during your time here. Each project, advised by a software engineer, promotes a comprehensive learning experience and provides you with meaningful work experience.
Community: Throughout the summer, we host a variety of educational, social and team-building activities to foster friendship and camaraderie.
Housing: DRW provides fully furnished apartments located close to the office –making your morning commute as easy as possible.
Mentorship: You’ll build a professional relationship with an experienced mentor in your field. Mentors and mentees meet to discuss goals, challenges and professional development and explore the city together at our mentor outings.
Education: As technology continues to drive the trading industry forward, both in terms of new products and transaction methods, the future will present us with unique opportunities and challenges. To prepare you for how technology will continue to impact trading’s future landscape, you will complete an options course framed from a developer’s standpoint to help you visualize how your technology solutions will be used in real time. As the trading industry continually evolves, both in terms of new products and transaction methods, the future will present us with unique opportunities and challenges.

DRW is a technology-driven, diversified principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in financial markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW – maximizing opportunities to include real estate, cryptoassets and venture capital. With over 1,000 employees at our Chicago headquarters and offices around the world, we work together to solve complex problems, challenge consensus and deliver meaningful results. It’s a place of high expectations, deep curiosity and thoughtful collaboration.

The IT Intern will also be involved with large scale testing and production implementations for web applications. The IT Interns will also have the opportunity to participate in departmental meetings within the department to gain better knowledge of the operations.

Familiarity with programming concepts desired.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Why MSC
People. Collaboration. Insight. That’s how you build something that works.

Built on a foundation of trust, MSC works side by side with our customers to help them drive business results. With more than one million product offerings and 75+ years of experience across industries, MSC strives to help our customers achieve greater productivity, profitability, and growth through inventory management and other innovative supply chain solutions.

Colgate is more than just another brand - whether it is research, product development, marketing, or optimization, we are always looking for new, efficient ways to serve our customers and continue to create a brand people can rely on. In this 6-month program, you will help identify areas of potential insights within our business teams and work alongside data scientists using state of the art machine learning techniques to deliver meaningful results.

Responsibilities will include:
Use statistics and machine learning techniques to explore and understand relationships within datasets.

Work directly with Data Scientists, Business Analysts and Data Engineers to build solutions and provide analytical support.

Guide business users to ask good questions to maximize value from their data

Collaborate with business teams to optimize their current workflow using analytics

Help drive the adoption of advanced analytical tools within the organization

Qualifications:
Authorized to work in the U.S. without requiring sponsorship now or in the future

Must be currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program (Master’s degree preferred)

Majoring in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or a similar field with a focus on predictive analytics

A minimum GPA of 2.8

Ability to work in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment

Availability to work a minimum of 15-20 hours per week

Experience analyzing data with a scripting language (Python or R), SQL

Knowledge of basic machine learning types (regression, classification, ensemble methods)

Knowledge of statistical methods and hypothesis testing

Familiarity with relational databases, as well as unstructured data

Willingness to learn new technologies

Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences

Communicate and visualize technical results to non-technical audiences (business teams, leaders, and senior management)

Preferred:
Available to commit 6 months

Knowledge and experience with deep learning, reinforcement learning, natural language processing

Experience with the following technologies:
Popular Python packages (sklearn, scipy, numpy, pandas, keras, matplotlib, plot.ly)

Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform

Project management tools (Git, Trello)

Full Job Description
On January 11, 2021, we announced our intent to separate our severe genetic disease and oncology businesses into differentiated and independent publicly traded companies. We will retain focus on severe genetic disease (SGD) and will launch our oncology business ("Oncology Newco") as a new entity, with the completed transition expected by the end of 2021.

ABOUT THE NEST

At bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. When you join the nest, you're not just landing a new gig, you become a part of a flock that's soaring to new heights. We're 1100+ doers, thinkers and collaborators across the globe with a strong sense of our values and our purpose. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our teams and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. This is personal and we approach every challenge with radical care. The time is now to rise up and recode the science, the systems, and the status quo.
Data Sciences Co-Op/Full-Time Intern

ABOUT THE FLOCK

You will be a member of the bluebird bio Data Sciences team. The team works across research, clinical, and manufacturing sciences to advance our cellular therapies by leveraging expertise in bioinformatics, statistics, disease biology, and genetics. Come work with a cheerful, nerdy group who loves rising to challenges, exploring exciting science, and delivering data sciences solutions to our collaborators and, ultimately, to patients!

HOW YOU'LL FLY

As a Data Sciences Co-Op/Full-Time Intern bird reporting to a Data Scientist I , you will collaborate with fellow data scientists and biologists to produce data-driven insights enabling bluebird bio's cell therapy technologies to combat cancer. This opportunity is flexible to incorporate the interests and goals of the trainee, including projects which:

Develop visualization tools and strategies to increase the access and ease of exploration of high-dimensional datasets.

Answer critical research questions by developing custom computational tools and/or performing exploratory analysis of new experimental next-generation sequencing datasets.

Mine emerging public data resources to help identify and characterize novel cancer targets.

Support the characterization of candidate cell therapies using high dimensional datasets generated by next-generation sequencing and single-cell technologies.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

You're the bird we're looking for if you:
You enjoy solving problems and exploring data.

You have experience coding in Python and/or R.

You are currently enrolled in a degree program (BA/BS, MA/MS, PhD, or equivalent), preferably in Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Engineering, Genetics/Molecular Biology/Immunology or a related field.

You have excellent organizational skills, are independently motivated, and can multi-task in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.

You have strong verbal and written skills and are excited to work in collaborative and multi-disciplinary teams (Data Sciences, IT, wet-lab research groups)

Possess the ( Ability to work a six-month assignment, full-time – ASAP through December 17 )

This position is intended to be on-site in our Seattle, WA, location, but the opportunity for remote work may exist.

All our birds embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, b yourself.

bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth.

bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Full Job Description
Who is Grant Thornton?

Hi. We’re Grant Thornton LLP, the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd (A.K.A. one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.) With us, business feels more personal — for our clients and for you. That makes us different. Better. And we’re looking for applicants who are too.

Different how? It means working with numbers doesn’t make you a number. Here, your voice matters. Our inclusive community and caring culture rejects limits and egos, which helps make our work stronger and you thrive. From our global clients and no-silos style, we empower you with opportunity from day one, then set you up for long-term success with flexibility, resources and connections. It’s how we help you create a career you love — and more.

Interested? Get to know us better at gt.com/careers and read on to learn more how you’ll help us become even bolder:

What is Risk?

The digitization of currencies, transactions, relationships, experiences and assets has transformed entire industries. Technologies extend borders and reach, creating new customers, business partners, avenues of access, methods of innovation and forms of value. At the same time, ongoing disruption in the marketplace and in the competitive and regulatory landscape presents continually evolving strategic, operational, financial and other risks.

To move forward in this challenging environment, many management teams are turning to advisers like Grant Thornton LLP for broader industry and business perspectives and proven experience to assist them with developing and implementing their risk management programs, and providing attestations and certifications to validate the risk mitigation strategies relevant to their customers.

Grant Thornton’s Advisory professionals are progressive thinkers who create, protect, transform value today, so our clients have the opportunity to thrive and grow. Our advisory practice creates holistic solutions delivered by innovative, curious professionals who bring technical depth and industry insight to our clients.

POSITION SUMMARY:
Risk Interns are responsible for delivering engagements ranging from business process and information systems controls assessments and testing to support regulatory, compliance and other strategic and operational and attestation engagements.

RISK ADVISORY SERVICES ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Evaluate and test business processes and IT controls and identify areas of risk
Apply current knowledge of trends to identify business risk management issues and other opportunities for improvement
Work with the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business risks and issues and supporting controls
Work with risk teams and the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business process and IT controls risks and issues
Execute assigned client engagements from start to completion of information systems assessments and/or business process control reviews
Gain a comprehensive understanding of assigned client operations, processes and business objectives, and then utilize that knowledge on assigned engagements
Participate in recruiting efforts as needed
Meet or exceed targeted billing hours (utilization)
Assist practice leadership in creating proposals, budgets, and work plans. Participate in other business development activities as appropriate
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications - External

Why become a Risk Intern?

A Risk Intern will gain exposure to various areas of the practice by participating as an active member on consulting and compliance projects and by becoming an integral part of the delivery teams. As a Risk Intern your primary responsibility will be executing high quality Risk projects and services from beginning to end under the supervision of experienced Risk leadership. You will be responsible for efficiently managing your workload to budget and learning how to apply technical skills across our various Risk solutions. As a Risk Intern you’ll have opportunities to build client relationships by developing a deep understanding of our clients’ businesses and delivering value through your insight and quality work. In addition, as a Risk intern you’ll focus on continuously developing your technical and professional skills to grow and expand your role in the Risk practice. Additional responsibilities may include:

Performing detailed analysis to identify and assess compliance or opportunities for improvement, documenting conclusions, and providing recommendations
Utilizing and continuously learning new technologies to collaborate with team members and enhance service delivery
Utilizing various data collection techniques, selecting appropriate method and prioritization to fit project objectives and deliverables, and applying established analytical models to evaluate data, costs and benefits
What are we looking for in an Intern?

Interested candidates should be self-starters and should demonstrate strength in or a desire to build skills related to Grant Thornton’s core values of: Collaboration, Leadership, Excellence, Agility, Respect and Responsibility.

Risk Advisory Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Information Technology, MIS or related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
Desire to pursue CPA, PMP, CISA, CISSP, CIA, CAMS, or CISM license/certification preferred
Major and overall GPA of 3.2/4.0
Ability to work additional hours as needed and travel 60%-100% as required

Skill Requirements
Interest to work cross functionally throughout different business processes within an organization
Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
Strong technical aptitude and problem-solving skills
Effective project and time management skills for handling multiple priorities and simultaneous projects
Enthusiasm to learn through a combination of structured, on-the-job and self-directed training
Ability to work efficiently and effectively in a complex team environment
Desire to pursue applicable professional certification as outlined above
Exceptional client service and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain outstanding client relationships
Ability to manage multiple engagements and competing priorities in a rapidly growing, fast-paced, interactive, results-based team environment
Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills. Additionally, excellent analytical, organizational, and project management skills

As part of our Risk team you would help our clients assess their internal controls environment via Internal Audit, SOX Readiness / Compliance, Attestation and IT Certification projects. Risk Interns are exposed to various projects across Risk solutions, allowing the interns to discover the advisory services most suited to their skills and interests. Interns can expect to work closely with other staff, managers, and partners on all phases of the engagement lifecycle including planning, engagement management, and project wrap up. In addition, interns are expected to actively contribute to Risk business growth by identifying business development opportunities, participating in marketing and brand initiatives and assisting with development of Grant Thornton thought leadership.

TRAINING:
Grant Thornton LLP provides both local and national training programs related to an individual’s job responsibilities. We are committed to ongoing professional development and we encourage individuals to attend outside training seminars.

BENEFITS:
Grant Thornton LLP offers an outstanding opportunity for career growth and development, an attractive compensation and incentive program, generous benefits including immediate participation in our 401(k) plan, and a flexible work environment that offers individual enrichment opportunities in a team environment.

It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

We are seeking future Software Developers with a background in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or IT to come join us for their co-op or internship in order to gain real world experience.

Exacta is our proprietary software created in house at Bastian Software. Our internships and Co-op begin in the QA department doing manual integrated testing for existing, modified, or custom software to be implemented for our clients. Testing the software will give an introduction to our software and learn its functionality and purpose. You will have exposure to technical tools including MS Visual Studio/Team Foundation Server, MS Office, Hyper-V or VMware, Windows Server, and Oracle. As you grow and grasp the Exacta Software you will transition to the Development team.

Requirements

In pursuit of their Bachelors or Master’s degree.
Eager to learn in Visual Studio, C#, Visual C++, SQL Server and/or Oracle
Strong quality control and computer skills including ability to learn how to manually deploy and test software
Strong troubleshooting skills.
Ability and willingness to learn
Must be eligible to work in the USA long term without sponsorship.

About Bastian

Bastian Solutions, a Toyota Advanced Logistics company, is an independent material handling and robotics system integrator providing automated solutions for distribution, manufacturing, and order fulfillment centers around the world. Our team specializes in consulting, system design, project management, maintenance, and installation, while sourcing the best equipment and automation technology. We take great pride in providing exceptional service and flexibility to our customers.

In addition to exciting work at a growing company, we offer the following benefits:

Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
401(k) Retirement Plan with a company match
Vacation/Holiday Pay
Tuition Reimbursement
Flexible Work Schedules
Volunteer Work
Professional Associations, Conferences and Subscriptions
Company Meetings & Events

Bastian Solutions does not work outside recruiting agencies. No solicitation phone calls please.

Full Job Description
Who is Grant Thornton?

GrantThornton is a collaborative, entrepreneurial firm on the move! As part of adynamic, global organization of more than 42,000 people serving clients in morethan 120 countries, we have the agility and focus it takes to be a leader.

Founded in Chicago in 1924, Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton)is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of theworld’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.Grant Thornton has revenue in excess of $1.56 billion and operates 58 officesacross the United States with more than 565 partners and 8,000+ employees.

Grant Thornton works with abroad range of publicly and privately held companies, government agencies,financial institutions, and civic and religious organizations. Core industries served include consumer andindustrial products, financial services, not-for-profit, private equity, andtechnology. Grant Thornton focuses on serving dynamic organizations that pursuegrowth holistically – whether through revenue improvement, leadership, missionfulfillment or innovation.

Weare committed to capitalizing on our strengths and serving dynamicorganizations that share our values and drive. Our global values of collaboration, leadership, excellence, agility,respect, and responsibility (“CLEARR”) guide our behaviors and fuel ourambition to be the firm that makes a difference every day.

Weprovide companies with the guidance that they need to help run theirbusinesses, establish robust internal controls, use information effectively andimprove performance. These services includecompliance, consulting services, information technology solutions, forensicaccounting and investigative services, recovery and reorganization, taxpreparation, and valuation, to name a few.

What is Risk?

The digitization of currencies, transactions, relationships, experiences and assets has transformed entire industries. Technologies extend borders and reach, creating new customers, business partners, avenues of access, methods of innovation and forms of value. At the same time, ongoing disruption in the marketplace and in the competitive and regulatory landscape presents continually evolving strategic, operational, financial and other risks.

To move forward in this challenging environment, many management teams are turning to advisers like Grant Thornton LLP for broader industry and business perspectives and proven experience to assist them with developing and implementing their risk management programs, and providing attestations and certifications tovalidate the risk mitigation strategies relevant to their customers.

Grant Thornton’s Advisory professionals are progressive thinkers who create, protect, transform value today, so our clients have the opportunity to thrive and grow. Our advisory practice creates holistic solutions delivered by innovative, curious professionals who bring technical depth and industry insight to our clients.

POSITION SUMMARY:
Risk Interns are responsible for delivering engagements ranging from business process and information systems controls assessments and testing to support regulatory, compliance and other strategic and operational and attestation engagements.

RISK ADVISORY SERVICES ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Evaluate and test business processes and IT controls and identify areas of risk
Apply current knowledge of trends to identify business risk management issues and other opportunities for improvement
Work with the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business risks and issues and supporting controls
Work with risk teams and the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business process and IT controls risks and issues
Execute assigned client engagements from start to completion of information systems assessments and/or business process control reviews
Gain a comprehensive understanding of assigned client operations, processes and business objectives, and then utilize that knowledge on assigned engagements
Participate in recruiting efforts as needed
Meet or exceed targeted billing hours (utilization)
Assist practice leadership in creating proposals, budgets, and work plans. Participate in other business development activities as appropriate
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications - External

Why become a Risk Intern?
A Risk Intern will gain exposure to various areas of the practice by participating as an active member on consulting and compliance projects and by becoming an integral part of the delivery teams. As a Risk Intern your primary responsibility will be executing high quality Risk projects and services from beginning to end under the supervision of experienced Risk leadership. You will be responsible for efficiently managing your workload to budget and learning how to apply technical skills across our various Risk solutions. As a Risk Intern you’ll have opportunities to build client relationships by developing a deep understanding of our clients’ businesses and delivering value through your insight and quality work. In addition, as a Risk intern you’ll focus on continuously developing your technical and professional skills to grow and expand your role in the Risk practice. Additional responsibilities may include:
Performing detailed analysis to identify and assess compliance or opportunities for improvement, documenting conclusions, and providing recommendations
Utilizing and continuously learning new technologies to collaborate with team members and enhance service delivery
Utilizing various data collection techniques, selecting appropriate method and prioritization to fit project objectives and deliverables, and applying established analytical models to evaluate data, costs and benefits
What are we looking for in an Intern?

Interested candidates should be self-starters and should demonstrate strength in or a desire to build skills related to Grant Thornton’s core values of: Collaboration, Leadership, Excellence, Agility, Respect and Responsibility.

Risk Advisory Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Information Technology, MIS or related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
Desire to pursue CPA, PMP, CISA, CISSP, CIA, CAMS, or CISM license/certification preferred
Major and overall GPA of 3.2/4.0
Ability to work additional hours as needed and travel 60%-100% as required

Skill Requirements
Interest to work cross functionally throughout different business processes within an organization
Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
Strong technical aptitude and problem-solving skills
Effective project and time management skills for handling multiple priorities and simultaneous projects
Enthusiasm to learn through a combination of structured, on-the-job and self-directed training
Ability to work efficiently and effectively in a complex team environment
Desire to pursue applicable professional certification as outlined above
Exceptional client service and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain outstanding client relationships
Ability to manage multiple engagements and competing priorities in a rapidly growing, fast-paced, interactive, results-based team environment
Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills. Additionally, excellent analytical, organizational, and project management skills
As part of our Risk team you would help our clients assess their internal controls environment via Internal Audit, SOX Readiness / Compliance, Attestation and IT Certification projects. Risk Interns are exposed to various projects across Risk solutions, allowing the interns to discover the advisory services most suited to their skills and interests. Interns can expect to work closely with other staff, managers, and partners on all phases of the engagement lifecycle including planning, engagement management, and project wrap up. In addition, interns are expected to actively contribute to Risk business growth by identifying business development opportunities, participating in marketing and brand initiatives and assisting with development of Grant Thornton thought leadership.

TRAINING:
Grant Thornton LLP provides both local and national training programs related to an individual’s job responsibilities. We are committed to ongoing professional development and we encourage individuals to attend outside training seminars.

BENEFITS:
Grant Thornton LLP offers an outstanding opportunity for career growth and development, an attractive compensation and incentive program, generous benefits including immediate participation in our 401(k) plan, and a flexible work environment that offers individual enrichment opportunities in a team environment.

It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Full Job Description

Neighborhood Health Association (NHA), a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), is the largest community health center system in Northwest Ohio with partnerships that include ProMedica, Mercy Health, and University of Toledo Medical Center. NHA has grown from a single location in 1969 to 12 medical and dental clinics throughout Lucas County. Today we operate multiple health centers including pediatrics, adult medicine, dental services, and health care for the homeless, women’s health center, senior centers and a full service pharmacy with lab services on site.

For more than 50 years, NHA has placed a strong focus on prevention and empowering individual responsibility in managing their health care and overall well-being. Our services are acutely responsive to the needs of everyone throughout the communities we serve, providing excellent care and the best health practices.

Full Job Description

iOS Developer Intern

We are currently looking for enthusiastic and skilled iOS Developer Interns to join our Product development department and provide creative ideas and development work to help achieve specific product goals for iOS applications in the aviation industry. Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our growing company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee.

You will also be working directly on the product development teams, with Design and Marketing, and at times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the overall designing of the product. You will be fully hands-on working with many aspects of the products on the front-end and back-end.

We are looking for someone who is positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”.

You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, maintain clean, and clever swift codes
  • Able to build APIs
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of iOS applications
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
  • Work with the company's AI team and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the iOS application
  • Apply understandings of mobile, and native apps (iOS)
  • Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the iOS application
  • You will spend a lot of your time building iOS apps, efficiently coding in Swift. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes
  • Work in the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools
  • Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management
  • Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts
  • Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable.

Requirements

  • You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts
  • Previous experience with Xcode and Swift/Objective-C
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of mobile development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning
  • Developing proficiency in Swift, Cocoa Touch, Xcode, CocoaPods, git, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build iOS apps.
  • Developing proficiency in Java, JavaScript, Node.js, Angular (v7 or higher), PHP, Laravel, MongoDB, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build strong websites and mobile apps backend APIs.
  • Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor.
  • Loves to learn new things about programming each day.

This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment.

This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building, and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time employment.
