Full Job Description
Location: Bismarck or Fargo, ND

Summary of Work

Come join an award-winning team. Our office was recognized in 2020 and 2021 as a Top Workplace for Young Professionals. We are working towards a better government by providing truthful, objective and balanced information through audits for the citizens of North Dakota. We do this by following our core values: respect, excellence, leadership, integrity and teamwork.

Jump-start a career in the field of auditing by joining our team. Internships at the State Auditor’s Office receive hands-on experience in the field of government auditing. As an intern, you will work alongside experienced accountants and CPAs to provide support in all aspects of government auditing. Job duties assigned will begin at entry-level tasks and increase in complexity as job knowledge increases. Duties may include: interviewing clients on business processes and procedures, conducting tests, writing recommendations and doing audit research.

We are looking for someone to work up to 20 hours per week during the academic school year. Hours are flexible to accommodate classes. Our standard office hours are 7 a.m. until 5 p.m., Monday through Thursday and 7 a.m. until 11 a.m., Friday. The intern’s hours will be flexible to fit within our work schedule and the student’s class schedule.

Starting hourly pay at a rate of $16 per hour, with the potential for pay raises based on performance. No other benefits will be provided.

Minimum Qualifications

A junior or senior working toward a bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, economics, information technology or mathematics.
Applicant must be working towards receiving academic credit for internship and be a current full-time student.
Must be able to effectively communicate orally and in writing with other office employees and audit clients.
Requires successful completion of the hiring process including reference, background and criminal record checks.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products including Word and Excel.
Preferred Qualifications

Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher
Critical thinking and analytical ability
Application Procedures

Applicants must complete the State of North Dakota online application, along with uploading a cover letter, addressing how all minimum qualifications/requirements are met, a current résumé, and an unofficial college transcript. Applications must be completed by 11:59 pm on the posted closing date.

For more information or if you need accommodation or assistance in the application or selection process contact:

Heidi Morman

600 E. Boulevard Avenue – Dept. 117

Bismarck, ND 58505

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, maintain clean, and clever Mean Stack codes
  • Work with the popular CMS WordPress
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of web applications
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
  • Work with the company's AI department and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the company’s web applications
  • Apply understandings of web and mobile web app (Mean Stack)
  • Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the web applications
  • You will spend a lot of your time building web apps, efficiently coding in Mean Stack. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes
  • Work with the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools
  • Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management
  • Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts
  • Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable.

Requirements

  • You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts
  • Previous experience with javascript, Angular, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and Java
  • Previous working experience with WordPress.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of web development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning
  • Developing proficiency in Angular (v7 or higher), Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, Git, Postman, GitHub, AWS, PHP, Laravel, Rest/Restful, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build our web apps.
  • Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor.
  • Loves to learn new things about programming each day.

This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment.

This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time position.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

COVID-19 considerations:
To keep our Siblings safe, we will remain fully remote until a working vaccine for COVID-19 is widely available, and the country has reached herd immunity.

Application Question(s):

  • Are you able to start working remotely within 1-2 weeks? (Yes/No)

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

  • MEAN Stack: 1 year (Required)
  • MERN Stack: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

  • English (Required)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Work Remotely:

  • Yes

position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Description
At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation. We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.
We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022 BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting. Where the Chemistry Happens… You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).
Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.
The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills
Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You… We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.
Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers .
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers.

The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen.
' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022.
' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area.
' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
  • Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed.
  • Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.
How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021.

Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt.

Applicant packages should include:
' Resume,
' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests,
' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and
' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted).

Early Acceptance Incentive;
The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period.

If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail summerinterns@uwe.nsa.gov for application questions.

***PLEASE NOTE:
U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.

This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Full Job Description
On behalf of DFO Global Performance Commerce - its subsidiary agency, Amasa. DFO is on a mission to deliver superior eCommerce software, marketing, and products to make the world a better place.

ABOUT AMASA:
Amasa is a rapidly expanding digital marketing agency that is responsible for some of the most successful and innovative media and ecommerce campaigns online. We are expert, performance marketers who can complete the impossible when it comes to high volume global digital sales. We’ve tripled our growth in the past year, and are looking to go even further with amazing people like yourself!

Amasa is headquartered in downtown San Diego, CA.

OVERVIEW:
Are you a recent graduate looking to enter the fast-paced world of digital marketing and e-commerce? Want to learn how to craft digital marketing strategies for clients spending thousands per day on Facebook, Google, and through other programmatic online ad exchanges?

Eager to know how a multi-million dollar ecommerce agency is run and help real clients grow their business on day 1?

If so, you might be a fit for our internship program at Amasa. This internship will involve both remote work, and some socially-distant collaboration at our Gaslamp district office downtown. The office is regularly cleaned and sanitized, and we are following all CDC protocols for social distancing and safe reopening.

We are looking for smart, data-driven and creative young talent to train, then hopefully hire FULL TIME for our growing agency, in the role of either an Junior Account Manager or a Junior Facebook Media Buyer

In this role, you will:
Plan, manage, and execute digital media buys on Facebook and Instagram
Develop a collaborative relationship with internal and external creative teams to develop cutting-edge media assets.
Constantly learn and experiment new effective bidding, ad placement, and management techniques
Prepare research and insights to inform ongoing media recommendations
Learn to continuously monitor campaign performance and return-on-ad-spend (ROAS), while suggesting and executing ongoing optimization strategies to hit and exceed assigned KPIs
Learn project management tools and software
Assist with developing custom marketing proposals to both startups and global brands
Brainstorm and suggest marketing angles for clients
Perform administrative duties for meetings and other client related tasks
Learn how to A/B test ad creatives and various website components
Help with video and creative shoots
Create and analyze campaign performance reports to inform relevant teams at Amasa.
Perform other related duties as required or assigned

REQUIREMENTS:
Degree in one of the following subjects preferred: Business, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance/Accounting, Psychology, Public Relations
Ability to come into the office 2x per week, and work remote (20-25 hours per week total)
Must be creative and have the desire to sell somebody something
Enjoy wearing many hats and managing several projects at one time
Strong communication skills
Computer proficiency
Social media savvy

BENEFITS:
Company issued Macbook Pro or PC
Office stocked with snacks, drinks, and beer
Work alongside awesome young talent and learn real world skills that are transferable to dozens of high earning jobs in a number of fields
Free parking

ADDITIONAL INFO:
Full-time employment potential after 3 months
Position Opening Date: Immediate

Please submit your resume and a short cover letter telling us a bit more about yourself and what makes you qualified here.

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Career Developers Inc.
3000 N Ocean Drive, S. 5H
Riviera Beach, FL 33404

Specializing in Contract and Permanent hiring in Technology/Pharma/Accounting/Marketing

Full Job Description
NVIDIA's deep learning platform has already made a major impact to the field and is broadly used across leading academic institutions, start-ups, and industry, including the world’s largest Internet companies. We need passionate, hard-working and creative people to help us dive into more of these rare opportunities of GPU application in consumer and enterprise solution space.

We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern to join the NVIDIA Applications Engineering team to work as a full stack Web Developer and write Electron-based native applications for customer tools. This is a highly technical engineering support role that is responsible for providing best-in-class application support to NVIDIA's internal and external customers. Skills required include front-end development, back-end development and agile engineering practices. If you are someone who has superb technical and interpersonal skills to capture customer requirements, develop and deploy applications, this is the role for you! Join our dynamic team today!

What you'll be doing:
You will be responsible for the entire development cycle from design, development, testing and deployment of NVIDIA customer tools and internal website.

Help with writing clean, reusable ReactJS components for front-end website and native applications using Electron framework.

Work on new feature development along with architecting backend APIs in Rails (SQL) or Node (MongoDB).

Minority Programmers Association is an international network of programmers and activists empowering underrepresented communities through STEM education, mentorship, job placement, and the development of socially impactful software solutions.

https://minorityprogrammers.org/

One of the biggest technologies that can empower minorities and those in developing nations is blockchain. In order to build on blockchains, the Minority Programmers Association is proud to announce the creation of a Solidity Developer Intern position (unpaid).

We are seeking an energetic go-getter who is passionate about giving to the community and innovating through blockchain

This role will report to Lead Blockchain Engineer at Minority Programmers Association.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collaborating with managers to determine blockchain technology needs and envisaged functionalities
  • Running ethereum smart contracts and deploying onto Ethereum mainnet and other ethereum compatible blockchain like Polygon, Harmony

Company Summary

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Target Openings

30

Job Description Summary

The intent of this position is to provide our 2021 Travelers Summer Interns and Summer Students the ability to apply to our 2022 Technology Intern opportunities. Applications outside of this audience will not be considered at this time. However, for additional positions posted at a later date we encourage anyone who was not a Summer Intern and Summer Student between June 2021-August 2021 to apply at that time.

The Internship program is based in Hartford, CT, Hunt Valley, MD, and St. Paul, MN. Positions are available in our Business Units and Corporate Departments. Subsidized apartments are available for students who live beyond a commutable distance from Hartford, CT or St. Paul, MN. Positions are available early June through the end of the summer.

The goal of the Technology Leadership Development Program (TLDP) internship is to attract and develop self-motivated individuals who are highly skilled and passionate about a career in technology while providing a foundation for future success within the organization. As a TLDP intern, you will be exposed to a challenging professional work experience in technology with planned activities providing you insight into business, technology, and the many career options at Travelers. You will not only be able to gain a deeper understanding of what you can do in technology but also who we are as a company and how you fit within our Technology community. You will receive a combination of hands on experience, access to a technology curriculum, as well as mentoring program. With many company-wide events such as Intern Symposium and community outreach events, you will have the opportunity to interact and network with many levels of leadership and management. You will be expected to work together with fellow interns to develop and present solutions to relevant business and technology topics.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

The internship offers hands on experience in areas of software engineering which is supported by a technology and business development curriculum, an assigned internship manager, and technical mentors. The 10-12-week experience will provide first-hand opportunities for interns to apply what they have conceptually learned in academia in a real-world setting.

Minimum Qualifications

Obtained or pursuing a technology or business-related undergraduate degree with technology minor; or a graduate degree with a technology minor; or the successful completion of a state-licensed accelerated technical learning program in technology (e.g. bootcamp) teaching foundational software development skills.
Legally authorized to work in the United States now and in the future.

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater preferred; Suggested majors include (but not limited to): Software Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, and Cybersecurity.
Exposure to Object-oriented programming (OOP) in one major language.

Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

Accountability: Strong track record of taking ownership and responsibility for actions and outcomes, performance, and results.
Analytical and Critical Thinking: Demonstrated aptitude in identifying current or future problems or opportunities, analyzing data, synthesizing and comparing information to understand issues, identifying cause/effect relationships and exploring alternative solutions to support sound decision making.
Change Management/Resilience: Ability to remain energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands.
Customer Focus: Proven customer service skills with the ability to provide service excellence to internal or external clients.
Emotional Intelligence: Demonstrated track record of self and social awareness, empathy and balances confidence with humility.
Interpersonal: Excellent communication skills with the ability to actively engage with others while maintaining a positive attitude.
Judgment/Decision Making: Capability of exercising sound judgment, making decisions and committing to a position.
Learning agility: Demonstrated aptitude for learning and applying new capabilities in actuarial and analytics.
Leveraging Differences: Proven capacity to works with and include people from different backgrounds, experiences, cultures, races, etc. and view those differences as assets to be leveraged to accomplish business goals and objectives.
Relationship Management: Strong relationship management skills including the ability to seek out, build, foster and maintain productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results.
Teamwork: Ability to work together in situations when actions are interdependent, and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result.
Technical curiosity: Self-starter with a strong track record of exploring new technologies, applications and environments beyond required job and/or educational commitments.
Work Ethic: Possession of a strong drive to do what it takes to get the job done; inquisitive and demonstrates a strong willingness to learn.

Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Career Developers Inc.
3000 N Ocean Drive, S. 5H
Riviera Beach, FL 33404

description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Project:
The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.

The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: August 2021 - January 2022

In this role, you’ll:
The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.

This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.

Who you are:
We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.

Responsibilities

Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
Assist in the support of planning and project management.
Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.

Qualifications

General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.

Technical Experience

A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

Full-stack Development
HTML5/CSS3
JavaScript
JavaScript Frameworks
jQuery
DevTools
Responsive/Adaptive Design
Cross-Browser Development
Content Management Systems
Testing/Debugging
Git/Version Control

Bonus Skills:
Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
Experience optimizing React applications.
Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.

Education and Professional Experience

In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
Computer Science
Web Performance Analytics
Full Stack Web Development
Front-End Web Development
User-Experience Design
Interactive Design and Media
Marketing & Business
Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.

Full Job Description

Unity Graphic Designer Intern

No salary * No equity * College credit

Robot Startup is an EdTech company that is designing a video game based on MorphBots—modular robotic cubes that can slide and self-assemble into anything the user can imagine. STEM/Robotic students and gamers are the target market for the MorphBot video game product. The MorphBot video game will be launched with an educational version and a pure gamer commercial version. We are working with several schools around the U.S. to commercialize our educational video game in 2021. Robot Startup is seeking an intern candidate with high-level experience in 3D graphics and a passion for designing Unity assets/objects/content in their craft.

Your commitments to this internship include the following:

- This internship is 4 months with consideration for renewal.

- You will sign an NDA (non-disclosure agreement) before beginning internship.

- This is an unpaid virtual internship (meetings in Zoom and Discord).

- This is internship is made for art & design majors, graphic design, and computer science with a focus in game design and pursuing careers as game developers.

- This internship is meant to give you experience with computer graphics (WebGL), Photoshop, 3D software (Unity) and to think like an entrepreneur.

- Group and individual video conferences will be held weekly discussing strategy and implementation, and reviewing results. Expected workload is 10-15 hours per week.

As a Unity graphic designer intern with Robot Startup, your activities will include the following:

- Graphic design assets in the MorphBots Unity based videogame.

- Meeting with the other MorphBot teams to discuss development and specifications.

- Working with the MorphBot Unity Team to establish strategy and development pipelines.

- Transforming design ideas into functional projects.

The requirements for this position:

- A very high level of expertise in Unity graphics otherwise please do not apply and do not waste your time.

- In-depth knowledge with Unity3D software.

- Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills.

- Advanced attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

- Solid communication skills (written and verbal).

- BS degree in Art & Design, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent

The benefits of doing this internship with Robot Startup are the following:

- Help bring a revolutionary video game based on robotics to schools that will motivate more U.S. students to pursue STEM careers as the world advances.

- Be part of a company that will give low-income schools an opportunity to begin their first robotics class with our MorphBots.

- Contribute to a technology that will change robotics forever because of its completely autonomous self-assembling nature.

Along with your application, please provide examples of relevant past work. If your portfolio is limited, you may provide a one-page description of any relevant experience or knowledge you think would contribute to this internship, any current best practices you would recommend, and any software gaming projects you may have done or used in the past.

BONUS: If you have any experience using robotic kits or playing robotic video games, please provide this experience in your description.

description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus
