position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
Fall 2021 Software Engineering Internship

The Position:
We are looking for current Computer Science or Computer Engineering students to join one of our software development teams in Tampa, Florida for Fall 2021 internships. If you are a current student or a student taking a gap year due to COVID and are interested in designing and building unique security software that no one else is building, then this exciting opportunity is for you. As part of a larger team, you will be given project-oriented work helping develop professional cybersecurity solutions used to protect critical infrastructure around the world. You will get exposure to every stage of the software development lifecycle, planning, design, coding, testing, and deployment amongst other stages.

What You Will Be Doing:
Project oriented hands on coding assignments and professional development activities.
Using latest cloud and on-premise technology stacks.
Contributing to the design and architecture of the solutions you work on.
Enhancing the automation testing framework to achieve test driven development.
Starting your career as a software engineer under the mentorship of experienced team members.

What We Need From You:
A passion for Cyber security and learning.
Progress toward a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, or a related major.
Examples of extracurricular programing projects (e.g. on Github).
Strong collaboration and communication skills.

About OPSWAT

OPSWAT is a global leader in critical infrastructure cybersecurity that helps protect the world's mission-critical organizations from malware and zero-day attacks. To minimize the risk of compromise, OPSWAT Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) solutions enable both public and private organizations to implement processes that ensure the secure transfer of files and devices to and from critical networks. In total, 98% of U.S. nuclear power facilities and more than 1,000 organizations worldwide spanning Financial Services, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Aerospace, Transportation Systems trust OPSWAT to secure their files and devices; ensure compliance with industry and government-driven policies and regulations, and to protect their reputations, finances, employees, and relationships from cyber-driven disruption. For more information, visit www.opswat.com.

To apply for this position, please send your resume and cover letter to us via JobScore. Special consideration will be given to those candidates whose cover letter indicates that they have viewed our website. Please, no drop-ins, calls, or faxes.

OPSWAT is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to providing an environment where equal employment opportunities are extended to all employees and applicants, free of discrimination and harassment of any type. All employment decisions are based on individual qualifications, job requirements, and business needs without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
Organization:
The Bail Project is a national nonprofit designed to combat mass incarceration by disrupting the money bail system one person at a time. The Bail Project’s National Revolving Bail Fund provides free bail assistance to low-income individuals who are legally presumed innocent, and whom a judge has deemed eligible for release before trial contingent on paying bail. We enable our clients to return home to their families and communities while awaiting their court dates, connect them with community organizations that can assist them in accessing resources, and provide reminders and assistance to ensure that clients return to court for their court dates.

The Intern Program:
The Intern Program invites members of the community, 18 or older, to intern with The Bail Project. All individuals who intern with TBP will be members of a cohort. All interns will be expected to participate in educational opportunities, community-building events, and other cohort activities. Interns will be expected to work 10-15 hours a week based on their availability. All interns will begin work on August 30, 2021. This is a hard start date and we encourage all candidates to consider this requirement carefully.

Position Summary:
TBP is seeking an individual with an interest in criminal legal system reform and improving outcomes for incarcerated and returning community members to assist with several data and research projects to improve TBP’s knowledge of system operations and community resources. This individual will also provide data input support by utilizing Salesforce.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week, flexible schedule

Term: August - November 2021

Start Date: 8/30/21

End Date: 11/30/21

Reports to: Volunteer and Intern Coordinator

Compensation: $15 an hour.

Responsibilities:
Document team referrals to social service providers in Salesforce.

Document client experiences with social service providers in Salesforce.

Use case lookup system to vet potential clients and provide recommendations to Bail Disruptors

Use court records and client records to improve TBP understanding of which clients retained private attorneys rather than public defenders and the impact that had on their cases.

Use court records and client records to determine which judges set bail for TBP clients.

Analyze and present preliminary findings on the degree to which judicial discretion plays a role in determining initial bail affordability and subsequent bail forfeitures for TBP clients.

Research client criminal backgrounds to understand past charges in relation to current charges.

Develop a list of community institutions and direct service agencies throughout TBP’s service area that may be willing to partner with TBP in providing support for TBP clients, advocate for the use of said institutions and agencies to team, and add to the database within Salesforce.

Research and connect with activist organizations working on criminal justice reform that clients may be interested in joining and advocate for the value in promoting said organizations.

Participate in cohort events geared towards social justice, policy, nonprofit management, etc.

Engage in weekly or bi-weekly check-ins with supervisor to evaluate progress, identify next steps, etc.

Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
You are driven, highly organized, and have a deep commitment to The Bail Project’s mission to eliminate race- and wealth-based disparities in our criminal justice system. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable working independently or in a team-based setting, and with a strong commitment to our clients.

To excel in this role, you likely bring the following:
Passion for understanding and changing the system of mass incarceration and criminal justice

Familiarity or personal experience with local criminal justice system a plus

Strong communication skills

Interest in data or computer science

Basic computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel preferred)

Some experience with quantitative research

Well-organized and professional

Familiarity with Salesforce a plus

How to Apply:
Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. In the cover letter, please address the following:

Why do you want to intern with The Bail Project?

Please share 1-2 experiences that highlight why you would be a strong candidate for this internship and how you meet the qualifications for the position.

No emails, faxes, or phone calls, please. Applicants will be notified regarding whether or not they have been selected for an interview. Applications without cover letters will not be processed.

Only candidates who live within a 90-minute radius of Baton Rouge will be considered for this role.

The Bail Project is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and actively seeks the candidacy of people of color, women, LGBTQIA people, and formerly incarcerated individuals. We are committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff.

Note: This position should ideally be filled by an undergraduate or graduate student, someone directly or indirectly impacted by the bail system, or an individual coming from an internship-providing institution.

Full Job Description
On January 11, 2021, we announced our intent to separate our severe genetic disease and oncology businesses into differentiated and independent publicly traded companies. We will retain focus on severe genetic disease (SGD) and will launch our oncology business ("Oncology Newco") as a new entity, with the completed transition expected by the end of 2021.

ABOUT THE NEST

At bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. When you join the nest, you're not just landing a new gig, you become a part of a flock that's soaring to new heights. We're 1100+ doers, thinkers and collaborators across the globe with a strong sense of our values and our purpose. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our teams and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. This is personal and we approach every challenge with radical care. The time is now to rise up and recode the science, the systems, and the status quo.
Project Gemini Co-Op/Full-Time Intern

We are seeking two (2) total Co-Ops/Full-Time Interns to support this project; one (1) in Finance, and one (1) in Human Capital Management. The role can be fully remote.

ABOUT THE FLOCK

bluebird bio's Global Information Technology team's mission is to deliver transformative, innovative technology solutions and services to bluebird and our patients. We are moving fast here at bluebird, working together as ONE TEAM in building a legendary gene therapy company, bringing hope to patients and their families. As a member of bluebird's team, we have the opportunity and privilege to deliver technology solutions and services to support patients, care givers and the healthcare organizations serving them through our gene therapy patient treatment pathway. We are a passionate, hardworking and friendly flock of IT birds who are looking for individuals to step outside their comfort zone, roll up their sleeves and help us scale this organization and influence the industry of cell and gene therapy, while learning and growing along the way. We invite you to come make your mark with us!

HOW YOU'LL FLY

As a Project Gemini Co-Op/Full-Time Intern bird reporting to the Director of Program Management and Business & Manufacturing Systems , you'll help to bring more patients their bluebird days by contributing to the overall success of our novel gene and cell therapy approach in Cambridge, Massachusetts. bluebird is currently in the process of creating 2 "nests," one for Severe Genetic Disease (SGD) and one for Oncology (ONC). This is a significant undertaking as we continue the business of improving peoples' lives and we need help to make this transition successful. As we create a new company (ONC) that has its own systems and processes, we will need help from smart / driven / passionate people to complete this project on time with quality. All roles will begin as virtual experiences due to current COVID-19 guidelines but the ability to enter a hybrid model will be reevaluated as time progresses. Students will have the opportunity to collaborate with leaders in their space and experience the inner workings of the creation of multiple businesses'. In these roles, primary responsibilities include:

Support the bluebird corporate separation "Spin-off" project by partnering with internal and external business stakeholders as we implement our Financial, Human Capital and Supply Chain administration systems to launch the separation.

Work in concert with the user community to test and confirm the new systems meet the business requirements and ensure the successful transfer of data between the bluebird and new company systems.

Contribute to a successful change management program to ensure that ONC has the systems and processes necessary for the corporate separation.

Support and / or perform end user training of the new system.

Develop working knowledge of the new system to assist the project team with any issues once the systems are live and to help the ONC business learn / utilize their new system.

Other tasks as needed.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

You're the bird we're looking for if you:
Have ( Currently enrolled in an undergraduate (BA/BS) or graduate (MA/MS/PhD) degree program at an accredited college or university, studying Accounting, Human Resources, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field of study through current or previous coursework )

Self-Motivated individuals willing to learn and who proactively seek input to deliver complex projects on time.

Should be proficient in MS Office.

Strong communication (written and verbal) skills and ability to build positive, and productive business relationships with internal business functions.

Knowledge of accounting, organizational management, business law, operations management or business analysis is preferred.

A strong attention to detail and organization is a must for this opportunity.

Possess the ( Ability to work a six-month assignment, full-time – July 12 – December 17 )

This position is intended to begin as remote, but those who are commutable and available to be on-site in our 60 Binney Street, Cambridge, MA, location as COVID-19 restrictions evolve may be welcomed.

What You'll Get Out of this Experience (skills, qualifications, and experience)

Hands on experience implementing Tier 1 Financial, and HR systems in the cloud.

Learn the business side in a life sciences company thru testing its systems and working with subject experts to bring a new system live.

Work in an environment where opportunity abounds and the need for people to drive results is large.

Become a member of the "bluebird community" of life science professionals that are making a difference in the world with leading edge science.

All our birds embrace the principles of the bluebird bio culture: b colorful, b cooperative, b yourself.

bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth.

bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Career Developers Inc.
3000 N Ocean Drive, S. 5H
Riviera Beach, FL 33404

Full Job Description
Who We Are

National Research Group (NRG) is a leader in data driven insights and strategic consultation to the global entertainment and technology industries. Working at the confluence of technology, content, and culture, NRG offers bold insights for storytellers everywhere. Our consultants have experience working across all facets of media and technology.

Why You'll Love It Here

We are inspired by working with storytellers that challenge us to think differently and see the world in new ways. As a result, our business is driven by creative, curious, and inventive people who have a passion for culture and technology. We work as a collective across disciplines and geographies to bring together the best thinking for every assignment, delivering insights to bold storytellers everywhere.

The Opportunity

NRG is seeking a Marketing Sciences Intern to join us for our 2021 fall internship program. Our internship is an opportunity for students to be provided with a hands-on experience to work in research, shaping strategy for the world's most powerful entertainment and technology brands. By assisting our Data/Marketing Sciences department, the intern will be able to develop proficiency in analytical techniques with structured and unstructured data sets which can be applied to future data analytics/data science roles. The intern will develop an understanding of how research is conducted and how our entertainment and technology clients use it to inform their business strategy. Below is general information on the internship.

Start Date: Mid-September

Commitment: 12 weeks

The Role

Support Data/Marketing Science team with a wide range of data analytic needs, including questionnaire design (including MaxDiff and conjoint techniques), multivariate analysis, segmentation, machine learning techniques and integrating 3 rd party data sources (such as digital clickstream data, receipt/transaction data, movie and TV consumption data) with quantitative survey data.

Assist team in using various statistical software and tools to evaluate data and develop both custom and productionized client solutions.

Work with and draw conclusions from large diverse data sets, via data fusion or other techniques.

Assist data processing team with taking respondent level data collected through surveys and assist them with the tabulation process.

Assist with developing frameworks, models, tools, processes, visualizations, simulators and analyses to ensure continuous data driven results are provided for internal and external clients.

Attend weekly meetings and share your opinions.

Potential career training opportunities where interns will learn about various lines of the business such as our Client Services and Business Development teams as well as our Research Operations teams including but not limited to Data Management, Marketing Sciences and Design.

Who You Are

Intellectually curious, analytically rigorous with a strong work ethic and solid business intuition.

Entrepreneurial, enthusiastic self-starter with an amiably competitive spirit.

Able to explain complex ideas to non-technical audiences, both verbally and visually.

Organized and able to plan projects efficiently including an ability to set priorities, problem solve and multi-task in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment, often with tight deadlines.

Highly motivated, self-directed, collaborative creative thinker.

Excited by data.

Critical thinker.

Ideal Candidate

Strong interest in entertainment and technology industries.

1+ year(s) of relevant coursework and/or experience working in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Behavior Science, Computer Science or related quantitative discipline.

Experience learning about analytics, statistical or data science academically or through previous internships.

Experience or familiarity with SPSS, R and SQL queries.

Advanced excel skills.

Candidates must be actively working toward an undergraduate or graduate degree and must be eligible to work in the US. Graduates may qualify if they have finished school within six months of the start of the internship.

Position Type

This is a temporary non-exempt remote position (for LA based employees there is the possibility of working out of our Culver City office depending on COVID-19 capacity guidelines). The minimum requirement to work for this team would be 3 days a week (full time availability is preferred). The hours of this position will be 9am-6pm PT.

Work Environment

This job typically operates in a professional office environment but will be remote due to circumstances of COVID-19. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.

Required Application Materials:
Resume

Cover Letter which should include:
Why do you want to work at NRG?

Why are you interested in data science?

What kind of training or experience have you had that has prepared you for this internship?

What do you hope to gain through this internship?

Assessment (if you move forward in the hiring process)

Full Job Description
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones.

As an intern, the Dolby U program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders. Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For anyone seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, join us to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

SUMMARY
Dolby Labs is looking for talented individuals to help develop the next generation of motion picture experiences – what we call Dolby Vision. The Platform Development Team is centered in Sunnyvale, California, and is responsible for delivering industry-leading algorithms and packages for video compression and color management. Of particular interest is enabling the creation and distribution of motion picture content containing wider color gamut and higher luminance levels far beyond anything that is available today. Above all, we strive to deliver a unique “In Dolby” experience that is immediately obvious to all viewers. Our interns will be conducting a series of development-related tasks involving research, development and customer support.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop software that enables the next generation video technologies created by Dolby
Engage in software development, mapping complex algorithms to existing encoder and decoder platforms, writing unit test applications, regression tests, and other test vectors
Comprehend the reference code from the research team with an in-depth understanding of each module
Develop unit tests, regression tests, and other test vectors to validate the implementations.
Create modular, well-organized, and properly documented code and produce accurate documentation

QUALIFICATIONS

Pursuing a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or related field
Proficient in C
Understanding of basic image processing and/or video processing concepts is desired
Experience with Python and Matlab is desired but not required
Experience with CMake is desired but not required
Ability to deal with fast-paced, frequent-changing tasks
Must be self-motivated and able to work independently

ELIGIBILITY

Pursuing a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering, or a related field; recent grads who are within 3 months of graduation are also eligible to apply
Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 6 months between September 2021 – March 2022. . The start date for this position is Monday, September 20, 2021. Please note the start date is not flexible.

Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Full Job Description
Kodak Alaris is a global technology company that’s delivering future value through customer solutions. Our advanced, patented intellectual property combines breakthrough technologies, digital transformation, and human know-how to unlock the power of images and information. We make businesses run faster, governments run smarter and provide consumers innovative solutions to preserve and enjoy their most cherished memories. Our future is powered by our employees’ creativity. Expect a lot from Kodak Alaris and know that we expect a lot of ourselves and the performance of the company.

Kodak Moments is a leading global provider of photo products and services to retailers, consumers, and entertainment properties. We inspire consumers to bring their memories to life--delivering innovative, high-quality photo products and experiences they find truly meaningful. Powered by over 100,000 consumer touchpoints across 30 countries globally, it's our mission to be the brand consumers choose to celebrate and preserve life's memories, from the big events to the everyday moments that matter.

Position Summary
The ideal candidate is knowledgeable of and has experience using RESTful APIs. The ideal candidate, working with our cloud platform team, will develop and deliver automated smoke tests using Postman and Newman and hooking these tests into our DevOps pipelines as deployment checkpoints. The platform makes it easy for our internal clients (Mobile and Web) to create personalized imaging products that can be fulfilled in-store in hours or mailed directly to their home through central lab in days. You will learn a lot work closely with the team to design, develop and test complex application software in a modern development environment using Agile Develop techniques and processes.

The individual will work on-site in our Rochester, NY office.

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop Automated API Tests using Postman.
  • Enable system deployment utilizing DevOps best practices.
  • Update pipelines to use test results to determine goodness and readiness to deploy code.
  • Create Postman Monitors to show build/test status results
Job Requirements

Qualifications & Experience
  • Knowledge and experience with restful APIs.
  • Understanding of DevOps practices.
  • Experience automating and testing cloud solutions to verify deployment readiness. (Postman, Advanced Rest Client other tools).
  • Experience with Microsoft technologies (Visual Studio .Net, C#, CosmosDB, NuGet, and SQL).
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Great communication skills, work ethic and willingness to be a team player
  • Working on obtaining a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related engineering discipline.
Skills & Competencies
  • Cloud computing knowledge with AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
  • C#, NodeJS, WCF, HTTP/HTTPS, REST, JSON, XML
  • Git, NuGet, Microsoft DevOps, CI/CD pipelines
  • D atabase systems SQL, NoSQL, CosmosDB

description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones.

As an intern, the Dolby U program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders. Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For anyone seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, join us to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

SUMMARY
Dolby’s Applied Vision Science Group is a small collaborative team within Dolby that investigates perceptual aspects of the human visual system and turns what we learn into image processing algorithms for improving perceived video quality. Our goal is to expand the reach of deep learning algorithms to solve fundamental problems pertaining to human perception. Understanding the relationship between science, art, and engineering is key to doing this well. Our group is looking for a motivated and energetic engineer/designer to join our team in Sunnyvale, CA and contribute to this meaningful effort.

We are specifically looking for a talented, curious, and inventive individual to develop synthetic deep learning datasets for face detection, video super-resolution, and other applications using modeling software such as Unity or Unreal. As part of the algorithm development team, you will be responsible for inventing, designing, and creating deep learning datasets while collaborating with other team members on our team.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop and design deep learning datasets for video processing tasks such as face detection and super-resolution
Create models in simulation software such as Unity or Unreal to create virtual tailored datasets
Work with members of the team to define dataset needs and use cases
Compile a curated and organized dataset that is well documented for future use

QUALIFICATIONS

Experience in modeling software and scripting in modern engines (Unity, Unreal, etc)
Experience with deep learning and dataset creation is a plus
Excellent communication and critical thinking skills; ability to prototype quickly
A team-oriented work ethic, and ability to work under minimal supervision

ELIGIBILITY

Working towards a Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, 3D Design, Imaging Science, Computer Graphics, or a related field; recent grads who are within 3 months of graduation are also eligible to apply
Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 3 months between September 2021 – December 2021. The start date for this position is Monday, September 20, 2021. Please note the start date is not flexible.

Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Equal Employment Opportunity:
Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

Nearest Secondary Market: Palo Alto

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Riviera Beach, FL 33404

position: Deep Learning Algorithm Engineering Intern - Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description
NVIDIA is seeking Software Engineer Interns for its Deep Learning Algorithms team to develop and commercialize Artificial Intelligence solutions to diverse real-world problems related to NLP, CV, Speech, Text, Recommendation Systems, etc.

Academic and commercial groups around the world are using GPUs to revolutionize AI and data analytics, and to power data centers. Come and help the team building the software which will be used globally. You will have a unique opportunity to interact with the scientific community to implement and improve the latest AI algorithms.

If you have a good understanding for deep learning and a strong algorithmic background, with exposure to computer architecture and performance, then this role may be a great fit for you, as you will be interacting with internal partners, users, and members of the open source community to analyze, define and implement highly optimized AI algorithms. The scope of these efforts includes a combination of implementing new algorithms, performance/ accuracy tuning and analysis, defining APIs, analyzing functionality coverage, and other general software engineering work. Ability to work in a dynamic, product-centric environment with excellent interpersonal skills are required, to be successful in this role.

If the idea of pushing the boundaries of state-of-the-art research and development excites you? Are interested in getting exposure to the entire DL SW stack? Then come join the team that build GPU-accelerated DL platform used worldwide.

What you’ll be doing:
Develop algorithms for deep learning, data analytics, machine learning, or scientific computing.

Construct and curate large problem specific datasets.

Analyze and improve performance of GPU implementations.

Collaborate with team members and other partners.

Keep up with the latest DL research and collaborate with diverse teams (internal and external to NVIDIA), including DL researchers, hardware and software engineers.

What we need to see:
You are pursuing a PhD or Masters or equivalent in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or Applied Math.

Strong Mathematical fundamentals and algorithms skills or experience.

You have excellent programming, debugging, performance analysis, and test design skills.

Ability to work independently and manage individuals’ R&D efforts.

Good communication and documentation habits.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Deep Learning experience.

Experience with DL Frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet).

Excellent C/C++ and Python programming skills.

Familiarity with DL inference, deployment, model conversion topics (e.g. Torch Script, Torch Trace, ONNX, TensorRT/TRT)

GPU programming (CUDA or OpenCL).

Experience doing performance analysis and tuning.

Exposure to HW architecture, ideally accelerators, and to numerical software.

Project management tools (e.g. JIRA, Git, Microsoft Project).

NVIDIA is one of the technology world's most desirable employers, and in this role you will have the opportunity to collaborate with forward-thinking and hardworking developers. Are you creative, driven and autonomous? Do you love a challenge? If so, we want to hear from you.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

position: Advanced Warfighting Technologies Division Intern- Fall 2021 - ACL
description:
Full Job Description
GTRI's Advanced Warfighting Technologies Division in the Advanced Concepts Laboratory seeks students for the position of Intern for the fall 2021 semester. The role of this position is to support various levels of the research and design process based upon their motivation, experience, and capabilities; which include, but are not limited to:
  • Ideation and development of cutting-edge warfighting capabilities and/or countermeasures
  • Software development
  • Experimental design and optimization
  • The gathering and processing of experimental data
  • Document and present individual and/or group research results
  • Other mission supporting tasks as required
The Advanced Warfighting Technologies Division provides world-class, forward-looking thought leadership and turn-key, best-of-class warfighting technologies focused on countering weapons of mass destruction (CWMD) and changing the future of ground maneuver warfare for the U.S. Government and other sponsors.

Required Minimum Qualifications

Intern

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Must be registered for at least 6 credit hours with your university during working semesters
  • 2.0 or higher GPA
  • Willingness to work in a fast-paced team environment
  • Experience in Java, C++, Python, Web, Javascript, PhP
  • Development experience in one of the following: M&S applications, GIS data, and software, Cotainerization/microserviecs, or AI
Preferred Qualifications

  • Understanding and experience with relational and non-relational database systems
  • Experience with data transmission protocols (TCP/IP, HTTPS, SMTP, etc.)

  • Development experience in M&S applications, GIS data, and software, Cotainerization/microserviecs, or AI

40 hours per week

Due to our research contracts with the US federal government, candidates for this position are required to be US Citizens.

Full Job Description
Supplemental Information

The Audit Department of Teachers' Retirement System of Louisiana (TRSL) is seeking a motivated graduate or undergraduate student possessing a strong work ethic, integrity, the ability to work well with others and perform audit duties with objectivity.

The successful candidate will assist the Audit Department in completing its annual audit plan which includes audits of TRSL employers (school boards, universities, etc.), internal TRSL processes and third party investment service providers, all while working in a positive working environment. The student intern will have the opportunity to develop the following skills while learning the internal audit process:

Plan and conduct audits
Analyze data using audit software (ACL)
Conduct legal and other research
Draft audit reports
Candidate may work up to 25 hours per week with a flexible schedule and is expected (but not guaranteed) to continue until the successful candidate is eligible to compete for a full-time position with TRSL. The salary for this position is $15 per hour.

Candidate must be a full-time student in an accredited college or university and pursing a degree in accounting, business administration, computer science, finance, government, law, or other qualitative or quantitative analysis and research fields with an overall 3.0 or higher grade point average. Some accounting background preferred.

How to Apply
To apply for this vacancy, click on the “Apply” link above and complete an electronic application which can be used for this vacancy as well as future job opportunities. Applicants are responsible for checking the status of their application to determine where they are in the recruitment process. Further status message information is located under the information section of the Current Job Opportunities page.

Please attach a copy of your transcript to your online application.

Resumes will be accepted as an attachment to your online application; however, all relevant education and experience must be included on your online application. Applications submitted without the education and/or work experience sections completed will be considered incomplete and will not be considered. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of an application listing complete work experience and education.

All prospective new hires will be subject to employment eligibility verification via the federal government’s E-verify system.

TRSL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act.
